titleStmt.title: The Dead Emperor
a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: This manuscript contains a draft of a poem first published in the New York Herald, March 10, 1888 entitled "The Dead Emperor". A note at top of the page states "sent Herald March 8" indicating that the draft was likely composed around the time of publication. On the verso appears part of a letter with Houghton Mifflin Publishers letterhead.

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: The Dead Emperor
bibl.orgName: Catalog of the Walt Whitman Literary Manuscripts at the Clifton Waller Barrett Library of American Literature, Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.
The verso includes a portion of a letter sent to Whitman with the date of 19 January 1888.

lg.head: The Dead Emperor
lg.l:
With bending head and eyes, thou too
Columbia

Less for for the might crown laid low ‸in sorrow —
less for the Emperor

AThy true condolence bringestsendest mourningbreathest out
mourningo'er the seas, afarmany a salt sea mile.
Amourning a good ole man — the faithful shepherd, —— a patriot, — natural
